hello.

On 2014-03-10, 23:10 , mike amundsen wrote:
> Yeah - I totally see your point. Can you join me on the UBER list to
> help sort this out?
> From: *Will Hartung* <willh@... <mailto:willh@...>>
>
> Mike, please, now, if you're going to specify something for XML, give it
> an official namespace identifier, and REQUIRE/MUST it.

+1, regardless of how much people love to hate namespaces.

what also would be required for robustness (this boils down to the fact 
that every format needs a processing model):

- talk about how to handle unspecified attributes
- talk about how to handle unknown elements in the über namespace
- talk about how to handle elements in non-über namespaces

all of this combined will give the result will wants to see: how to use 
über in a way that's extensible and open. on the other hand, if über 
claims to be an RDFish approach that can do anything because of its 
generality (which is how i see it for now), then it also would be fine 
to say that it cannot be extended or combined with anything, because any 
extension would have to be done *in* über instead of *of* über. that's a 
design question of the model itself, bit for the representation design 
in XML, will's suggestion makes a lot of sense.

cheers,

dret.
